Posts.Content: On 11/1/2008 dixielee wrote: any info on what to expect with chemo treatment/I went thru chemo and I was lucky.  I heard so many side effects are possible but luckily nothing happened to me.  I was a bit tired but not very unusual.  And I lost my hair but that's no big deal either.  Swollen ankles but I saw a lot worse,  So you never really know!
Posts.Title: chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Bonnie, Just want to let you know that I finished my chemo back in August of this year and luckily no bad side effects.  Maybe it'll turn out that way for you too.  And then I went onfor radiation and lo and behold that ended too.  Luckily, no severe side effects.  I did get some foot swelling and tiredness but no big deal.  I got medicine to take for nausea but luckily never needed it.  Things are normal now, more or less.  I just am hesitant to go take another mammogram but I guess I have to. Anyway, good lluck to you! Eva
Posts.Title: Terrified of Chemo - HELP!

Posts.Content: On 10/17/2008 Echos wrote: Hi everyone... I know I'm new here and I hope i'm not being intrusive, but I heard about this movie, Living Proof, that will be on lifetime tv tomorrow night (the 18th) at 9pm. It’s a real touching true story based on the book Her-2, which if you don’t know is about the oncologist and researcher Dr. Dennis Slamon, and his struggle behind developing the drug Herceptin and getting it approved. As a result of his efforts thousands of lives have been saved. I think it will be a touching movie and I wanted to share it with everyone here. There is more information right here http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=n0F__IfeUXg God Bless I watched and related.  I had a mixture of emotions--happy, sad, association etc.  It was great seeing women who benefited and yet sad hearing of women who didn't.  It was definitely worth watching for me.
Posts.Title: Her-2 Movie

Posts.Content: I also went thru everything you mentioned although I was stage 2. I'm now taking arimidex, only been on it for a few months, and so far so good.  No nausea or pains and hopefully not coming.  Maybe taking a pain reliever would help out in some way .  Have you spoken to your doctor?  He might also have something to help side effects.   Good luck! Eva
Posts.Title: Armimidex and side effects
